title: Lil Kim has an awkward run-in with animal rights protester in New York
text:
Lil Kim had a run-in with an animal rights protester in New York (Picture: GC Images)

Lil Kim was targeted by an animal rights protester in New York City and things got a little heated.

The rapper, 45, was making her way out of a building in the Big Apple when the protester ran up to her with a sign urging her to stop wearing fur.

In video footage obtained by TMZ, the protester is seen confronting Lil Kim and shouting: ‘Stop wearing fur! Stop wearing fur!’

The star’s security team were quick to step in, with a female bodyguard of Lil Kim’s ripping posters out of the protester’s hands before cornering her into a nearby wall – creating a barricade between Kim and the protester.

That didn’t stop the campaigner, who continued to shout: ‘Leave the animals alone. Have a heart.’

As things got a little tense, Lil Kim was seen squaring up to the protester (all while her security kept her at a distance) and repeatedly told them to ‘back up’.

Lil Kim was targeted by protesters (Picture: MediaPunch/Bauer-Griffin/GC Images)

The rapper was seen squaring up to the protester and telling them to ‘back up’ (Picture: GC Images)

‘Back up, back up, back up,’ she’s heard saying in the clip, before being ushered away by her team as they tried to diffuse the situation.

Metro.co.uk have reached out to Lil Kim’s rep.

Back in June, Lil Kim was forced to file for bankruptcy to help pay off debts totalling $4 million (£3,274,000).

The star, who became one of the leading female RnB performers in the 1990s, reportedly owed $1.8 million in back taxes to the government.

But since then, it seems like things have been looking up as Lil Kim has teased fans can expect new music from her this Autumn and she was recently honoured with the I Am Hip Hop Award at the BET 2019 Hip Hop Awards.

The incident occurred in NYC (Picture: Janet Mayer / SplashNews.com)

Lil Kim was given the I Am Hip Hop Award at the BET Hip Hop Awards in Brooklyn (Picture: Getty Images for BET)

Accepting the accolade, Kim, who performed a medley of her hits on stage at the ceremony, told the crowd: ‘I used to be a little tight because BET ain’t never give me an award.

‘My godmother said, “Baby, those awards aren’t big enough for you baby.” She said, “BET will give you the perfect award at the perfect time.”

‘When people give you the name Queen, you get rewarded differently. Never underestimate God’s plan. This award right here ain’t regular.’

She also paid tribute to Biggie Smalls during her speech, following her tribute to him at his street naming ceremony in Brooklyn in July.
